intro: Hedyotis cookiana var. elatior, commonly known as the greater bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional Māori medicine for its purported healing properties.
